   20: -module(erl_eval_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   24: 
   25: -export([guard_1/1, guard_2/1,
   26: 	 match_pattern/1,
   27: 	 match_bin/1,
   28: 	 string_plusplus/1,
   29: 	 pattern_expr/1,
   30:          guard_3/1, guard_4/1, guard_5/1,
   31:          lc/1,
   32:          simple_cases/1,
   33:          unary_plus/1,
   34:          apply_atom/1,
   35:          otp_5269/1,
   36:          otp_6539/1,
   37:          otp_6543/1,
   38:          otp_6787/1,
   39:          otp_6977/1,
   40: 	 otp_7550/1,
   41:          otp_8133/1,
   42:          otp_10622/1,
   43:          otp_13228/1,
   44:          otp_14826/1,
   45:          funs/1,
   46:          custom_stacktrace/1,
   47: 	 try_catch/1,
   48: 	 eval_expr_5/1,
   49: 	 zero_width/1,
   50:          eep37/1,
   51:          eep43/1,
   52:          otp_15035/1,
   53:          otp_16439/1,
   54:          otp_14708/1,
   55:          otp_16545/1,
   56:          otp_16865/1,
   57:          eep49/1,
   58:          binary_and_map_aliases/1,
   59:          eep58/1,
   60:          strict_generators/1]).
   61: 
   62: %%
   63: %% Define to run outside of test server
   64: %%
   65: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   66: 
   67: -import(lists,[concat/1, sort/1]).
   68: 
   69: -export([count_down/2, count_down_fun/0, do_apply/2,
   70:          local_func/3, local_func_value/2]).
   71: -export([simple/0]).
   72: -export([my_div/2]).
   73: 
   74: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   75: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   76: -export([config/2]).
   77: -define(line, noop, ).
   78: config(priv_dir,_) ->
   79:     ".".
   80: -else.
   81: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   82: -endif.
   83: 
   84: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   85:     Config.
   86: 
   87: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: suite() ->
   91:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   92:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   93: 
   94: all() ->
   95:     [guard_1, guard_2, match_pattern, string_plusplus,
   96:      pattern_expr, match_bin, guard_3, guard_4, guard_5, lc,
   97:      simple_cases, unary_plus, apply_atom, otp_5269,
   98:      otp_6539, otp_6543, otp_6787, otp_6977, otp_7550,
   99:      otp_8133, otp_10622, otp_13228, otp_14826,
  100:      funs, custom_stacktrace, try_catch, eval_expr_5, zero_width,
  101:      eep37, eep43, otp_15035, otp_16439, otp_14708, otp_16545, otp_16865,
  102:      eep49, binary_and_map_aliases, eep58, strict_generators].
  103: 
  104: groups() ->
  105:     [].
  106: 
  107: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  108:     Config.
  109: 
  110: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  111:     ok.
  112: 
  113: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  114:     Config.
  115: 
  116: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  117:     Config.
  118: 
  119: %% OTP-2405
  120: guard_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  122: 	erl_scan:string("if a+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end. "),
  123:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  124:     no = guard_1_compiled(),
  125:     {value, no, []} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  126:     ok.
  127: 
  128: guard_1_compiled() ->
  129:     if a+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end.
  130: 
  131: %% Similar to guard_1, but type-correct.
  132: guard_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  133:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  134: 	erl_scan:string("if 6+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end. "),
  135:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  136:     no = guard_2_compiled(),
  137:     {value, no, []} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: guard_2_compiled() ->
  141:     if 6+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end.
  142: 
  143: %% OTP-3069: syntactic sugar string ++ ...
  144: string_plusplus(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     check(fun() -> case "abc" of "ab" ++ L -> L end end,
  146: 	  "case \"abc\" of \"ab\" ++ L -> L end. ",
  147: 	  "c"),
  148:     check(fun() -> case "abcde" of "ab" ++ "cd" ++ L -> L end end,
  149: 	  "case \"abcde\" of \"ab\" ++ \"cd\" ++ L -> L end. ",
  150: 	  "e"),
  151:     check(fun() -> case "abc" of [97, 98] ++ L -> L end end,
  152: 	  "case \"abc\" of [97, 98] ++ L -> L end. ",
  153: 	  "c"),
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: %% OTP-2983: match operator in pattern.
  157: match_pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  158:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of {a, _X}=Y -> {x,Y} end end,
  159: 	  "case {a, b} of {a, X}=Y -> {x,Y} end. ",
  160: 	  {x, {a, b}}),
  161:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of Y={a, _X} -> {x,Y} end end,
  162: 	  "case {a, b} of Y={a, X} -> {x,Y} end. ",
  163: 	  {x, {a, b}}),
  164:     check(fun() -> case {a, b} of Y={a, _X}=Z -> {Z,Y} end end,
  165: 	  "case {a, b} of Y={a, X}=Z -> {Z,Y} end. ",
  166: 	  {{a, b}, {a, b}}),
  167:     check(fun() -> A = 4, B = 28, <<13:(A+(X=B))>>, X end,
  168: 	  "begin A = 4, B = 28, <<13:(A+(X=B))>>, X end.",
  169: 	  28),
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: %% Binary match problems.
  173: match_bin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  174:     check(fun() -> <<"abc">> = <<"abc">> end,
  175: 	  "<<\"abc\">> = <<\"abc\">>. ",
  176: 	  <<"abc">>),
  177:     check(fun() ->
  178: 		  <<Size,B:Size/binary,Rest/binary>> = <<2,"AB","CD">>,
  179: 		  {Size,B,Rest}
  180: 	  end,
  181: 	  "begin <<Size,B:Size/binary,Rest/binary>> = <<2,\"AB\",\"CD\">>, "
  182: 	  "{Size,B,Rest} end. ",
  183: 	  {2,<<"AB">>,<<"CD">>}),
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: %% OTP-3144: compile-time expressions in pattern.
  187: pattern_expr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     check(fun() -> case 4 of 2+2 -> ok end end,
  189: 	  "case 4 of 2+2 -> ok end. ",
  190: 	  ok),
  191:     check(fun() -> case 2 of +2 -> ok end end,
  192: 	  "case 2 of +2 -> ok end. ",
  193: 	  ok),
  194:     ok.
  195: 
  196: %% OTP-4518.
  197: guard_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  198:     check(fun() -> if false -> false; true -> true end end,
  199: 	  "if false -> false; true -> true end.",
  200: 	  true),
  201:     check(fun() -> if <<"hej">> == <<"hopp">> -> true;
  202: 		      true -> false end end,
  203: 	  "begin if <<\"hej\">> == <<\"hopp\">> -> true;
  204:                           true -> false end end.",
  205:                 false),
  206:     check(fun() -> if <<"hej">> == <<"hej">> -> true;
  207: 		      true -> false end end,
  208: 	  "begin if <<\"hej\">> == <<\"hej\">> -> true;
  209:                           true -> false end end.",
  210:                 true),
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: %% OTP-4885.
  214: guard_4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  215:     check(fun() -> if erlang:'+'(3,a) -> true ; true -> false end end,
  216: 	  "if erlang:'+'(3,a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  217: 	  false),
  218:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_integer(3) -> true ; true -> false end
  219: 	  end,
  220: 	  "if erlang:is_integer(3) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  221: 	  true),
  222:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3], erlang:is_integer(X)] end,
  223: 	  "[X || X <- [1,2,3], erlang:is_integer(X)].",
  224: 	  [1,2,3]),
  225:     check(fun() -> if is_atom(is_integer(a)) -> true ; true -> false end
  226: 	  end,
  227: 	  "if is_atom(is_integer(a)) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  228: 	  true),
  229:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_atom(erlang:is_integer(a)) -> true;
  230: 		      true -> false end end,
  231: 	  "if erlang:is_atom(erlang:is_integer(a)) -> true; "
  232: 	  "true -> false end.",
  233: 	  true),
  234:     check(fun() -> if is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end end,
  235: 	  "if is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  236: 	  false),
  237:     check(fun() -> if erlang:is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end
  238: 	  end,
  239: 	  "if erlang:is_atom(3+a) -> true ; true -> false end.",
  240: 	  false),
  241:     ok.
  242: 
  243: %% Guards with erlang:'=='/2.
  244: guard_5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
  246: 	erl_scan:string("case 1 of A when erlang:'=='(A, 1) -> true end."),
  247:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  248:     true = guard_5_compiled(),
  249:     {value, true, [{'A',1}]} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, []),
  250:     ok.
  251: 
  252: guard_5_compiled() ->
  253:     case 1 of A when erlang:'=='(A, 1) -> true end.
  254: 
  255: %% OTP-4518.
  256: lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  257:     check(fun() -> X = 32, [X || X <- [1,2,3]] end,
  258: 	  "begin X = 32, [X || X <- [1,2,3]] end.",
  259: 	  [1,2,3]),
  260:     check(fun() -> X = 32,
  261: 		   [X || <<X:X>> <- [<<1:32>>,<<2:32>>,<<3:8>>]] end,
  262: 	  %% "binsize variable"          ^
  263: 	  "begin X = 32,
  264:                  [X || <<X:X>> <- [<<1:32>>,<<2:32>>,<<3:8>>]] end.",
  265:                 [1,2]),
  266:     check(fun() -> Y = 13,[X || {X,Y} <- [{1,2}]] end,
  267: 	  "begin Y = 13,[X || {X,Y} <- [{1,2}]] end.",
  268: 	  [1]),
  269:     error_check("begin [A || X <- [{1,2}], 1 == A] end.",
  270: 		{unbound_var,'A'}),
  271:     error_check("begin X = 32,
  272:                         [{Y,W} || X <- [1,2,32,Y=4], Z <- [1,2,W=3]] end.",
  273:                       {unbound_var,'Y'}),
  274:     error_check("begin X = 32,<<A:B>> = <<100:X>> end.",
  275: 		{unbound_var,'B'}),
  276:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3,4], not (X < 2)] end,
  277: 	  "begin [X || X <- [1,2,3,4], not (X < 2)] end.",
  278: 	  [2,3,4]),
  279:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [true,false], X] end,
  280: 	  "[X || X <- [true,false], X].", [true]),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: %% Simple cases, just to cover some code.
  284: simple_cases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     check(fun() -> A = $C end, "A = $C.", $C),
  286:     %% check(fun() -> A = 3.14 end, "A = 3.14.", 3.14),
  287:     check(fun() -> self() ! a, A = receive a -> true end end,
  288: 	  "begin self() ! a, A = receive a -> true end end.",
  289: 	  true),
  290:     check(fun() -> c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,
  291: 		   receive b -> b end,
  292: 		   {messages, [a,c]} =
  293: 		       erlang:process_info(self(), messages),
  294: 		   c:flush() end,
  295: 	  "begin c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,"
  296: 	  "receive b -> b end,"
  297: 	  "{messages, [a,c]} ="
  298: 	  "     erlang:process_info(self(), messages), c:flush() end.",
  299: 	  ok),
  300:     check(fun() -> self() ! a, A = receive a -> true
  301: 				   after 0 -> false end end,
  302: 	  "begin self() ! a, A = receive a -> true"
  303: 	  "                      after 0 -> false end end.",
  304: 	  true),
  305:     check(fun() -> c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,
  306: 		   receive b -> b after 0 -> true end,
  307: 		   {messages, [a,c]} =
  308: 		       erlang:process_info(self(), messages),
  309: 		   c:flush() end,
  310: 	  "begin c:flush(), self() ! a, self() ! b, self() ! c,"
  311: 	  "receive b -> b after 0 -> true end,"
  312: 	  "{messages, [a,c]} ="
  313: 	  "     erlang:process_info(self(), messages), c:flush() end.",
  314: 	  ok),
  315:     check(fun() -> receive _ -> true after 10 -> false end end,
  316: 	  "receive _ -> true after 10 -> false end.",
  317: 	  false),
  318:     check(fun() -> F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == F(3) end,
  319: 	  "begin F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == F(3) end.",
  320: 	  true),
  321:     check(fun() -> F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == apply(F, [3]) end,
  322: 	  "begin F = fun(A) -> A end, true = 3 == apply(F,[3]) end.",
  323: 	  true),
  324:     check(fun() -> catch throw(a) end, "catch throw(a).", a),
  325:     check(fun() -> catch a end, "catch a.", a),
  326:     check(fun() -> 4 == 3 end, "4 == 3.", false),
  327:     check(fun() -> not true end, "not true.", false),
  328:     check(fun() -> -3 end, "-3.", -3),
  329: 
  330:     error_check("3.0 = 4.0.", {badmatch,4.0}),
  331:     check(fun() -> <<(3.0+2.0):32/float>> = <<5.0:32/float>> end,
  332: 	  "<<(3.0+2.0):32/float>> = <<5.0:32/float>>.",
  333: 	  <<5.0:32/float>>),
  334: 
  335:     check(fun() -> false andalso kludd end, "false andalso kludd.",
  336: 	  false),
  337:     check(fun() -> true andalso true end, "true andalso true.",
  338: 	  true),
  339:     check(fun() -> true andalso false end, "true andalso false.",
  340: 	  false),
  341:     check(fun() -> true andalso kludd end, "true andalso kludd.",
  342: 	  kludd),
  343:     error_check("kladd andalso kludd.", {badarg,kladd}),
  344: 
  345:     check(fun() -> if false andalso kludd -> a; true -> b end end,
  346: 	  "if false andalso kludd -> a; true -> b end.",
  347: 	  b),
  348:     check(fun() -> if true andalso true -> a; true -> b end end,
  349: 	  "if true andalso true -> a; true -> b end.",
  350: 	  a),
  351:     check(fun() -> if true andalso false -> a; true -> b end end,
  352: 	  "if true andalso false -> a; true -> b end.",
  353: 	  b),
  354: 
  355:     check(fun() -> true orelse kludd end,
  356: 	  "true orelse kludd.", true),
  357:     check(fun() -> false orelse false end,
  358: 	  "false orelse false.", false),
  359:     check(fun() -> false orelse true end,
  360: 	  "false orelse true.", true),
  361:     check(fun() -> false orelse kludd end,
  362: 	  "false orelse kludd.", kludd),
  363:     error_check("kladd orelse kludd.", {badarg,kladd}),
  364:     error_check("[X || X <- [1,2,3], begin 1 end].",{bad_filter,1}),
  365:     error_check("[X || X <- a].",{bad_generator,a}),
  366: 
  367:     check(fun() -> if true orelse kludd -> a; true -> b end end,
  368: 	  "if true orelse kludd -> a; true -> b end.", a),
  369:     check(fun() -> if false orelse false -> a; true -> b end end,
  370: 	  "if false orelse false -> a; true -> b end.", b),
  371:     check(fun() -> if false orelse true -> a; true -> b end end,
  372: 	  "if false orelse true -> a; true -> b end.", a),
  373: 
  374:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3], X+2] end,
  375: 	  "[X || X <- [1,2,3], X+2].", []),
  376: 
  377:     check(fun() -> [X || X <- [1,2,3], [X] == [X || X <- [2]]] end,
  378: 	  "[X || X <- [1,2,3], [X] == [X || X <- [2]]].",
  379: 	  [2]),
  380:     check(fun() -> F = fun(1) -> ett; (2) -> zwei end,
  381: 		   ett = F(1), zwei = F(2) end,
  382: 	  "begin F = fun(1) -> ett; (2) -> zwei end,
  383:                          ett = F(1), zwei = F(2) end.",
  384:                 zwei),
  385:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) when X == 1 -> ett;
  386: 			  (X) when X == 2 -> zwei end,
  387: 		   ett = F(1), zwei = F(2) end,
  388: 	  "begin F = fun(X) when X == 1 -> ett;
  389:                               (X) when X == 2 -> zwei end,
  390: 	  ett = F(1), zwei = F(2) end.",
  391:                 zwei),
  392:     error_check("begin F = fun(1) -> ett end, zwei = F(2) end.",
  393: 		function_clause),
  394:     check(fun() -> if length([1]) == 1 -> yes;
  395: 		      true -> no end end,
  396: 	  "if length([1]) == 1 -> yes;
  397:                             true -> no end.",
  398:                 yes),
  399:     check(fun() -> if is_integer(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  400: 	  "if is_integer(3) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  401:     check(fun() -> if integer(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  402: 	  "if integer(3) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  403:     check(fun() -> if is_float(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  404: 	  "if is_float(3) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  405:     check(fun() -> if float(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  406: 	  "if float(3) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  407:     check(fun() -> if is_number(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  408: 	  "if is_number(3) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  409:     check(fun() -> if number(3) -> true; true -> false end end,
  410: 	  "if number(3) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  411:     check(fun() -> if is_atom(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  412: 	  "if is_atom(a) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  413:     check(fun() -> if atom(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  414: 	  "if atom(a) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  415:     check(fun() -> if is_list([]) -> true; true -> false end end,
  416: 	  "if is_list([]) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  417:     check(fun() -> if list([]) -> true; true -> false end end,
  418: 	  "if list([]) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  419:     check(fun() -> if is_tuple({}) -> true; true -> false end end,
  420: 	  "if is_tuple({}) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  421:     check(fun() -> if tuple({}) -> true; true -> false end end,
  422: 	  "if tuple({}) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  423:     check(fun() -> if is_pid(self()) -> true; true -> false end end,
  424: 	  "if is_pid(self()) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  425:     check(fun() -> if pid(self()) -> true; true -> false end end,
  426: 	  "if pid(self()) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  427:     check(fun() -> R = make_ref(), if is_reference(R) -> true;
  428: 				      true -> false end end,
  429: 	  "begin R = make_ref(), if is_reference(R) -> true;"
  430: 	  "true -> false end end.", true),
  431:     check(fun() -> R = make_ref(), if reference(R) -> true;
  432: 				      true -> false end end,
  433: 	  "begin R = make_ref(), if reference(R) -> true;"
  434: 	  "true -> false end end.", true),
  435:     check(fun() -> if is_port(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  436: 	  "if is_port(a) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  437:     check(fun() -> if port(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  438: 	  "if port(a) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  439:     check(fun() -> if is_function(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  440: 	  "if is_function(a) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  441:     check(fun() -> if function(a) -> true; true -> false end end,
  442: 	  "if function(a) -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  443:     check(fun() -> if is_binary(<<>>) -> true; true -> false end end,
  444: 	  "if is_binary(<<>>) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  445:     check(fun() -> if binary(<<>>) -> true; true -> false end end,
  446: 	  "if binary(<<>>) -> true; true -> false end.", true),
  447:     check(fun() -> if is_integer(a) == true -> yes;
  448: 		      true -> no end end,
  449: 	  "if is_integer(a) == true -> yes;
  450:                             true -> no end.",
  451:                 no),
  452:     check(fun() -> if [] -> true; true -> false end end,
  453: 	  "if [] -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  454:     error_check("if lists:member(1,[1]) -> true; true -> false end.",
  455: 		illegal_guard_expr),
  456:     error_check("if false -> true end.", if_clause),
  457:     check(fun() -> if a+b -> true; true -> false end end,
  458: 	  "if a + b -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  459:     check(fun() -> if + b -> true; true -> false end end,
  460: 	  "if + b -> true; true -> false end.", false),
  461:     error_check("case foo of bar -> true end.", {case_clause,foo}),
  462:     error_check("case 4 of 2+a -> true; _ -> false end.",
  463: 		illegal_pattern),
  464:     error_check("case 4 of +a -> true; _ -> false end.",
  465: 		illegal_pattern),
  466:     check(fun() -> case a of
  467: 		       X when X == b -> one;
  468: 		       X when X == a -> two
  469: 		   end end,
  470: 	  "begin case a of
  471:                              X when X == b -> one;
  472: 	      X when X == a -> two
  473: 	 end end.", two),
  474:     error_check("3 = 4.", {badmatch,4}),
  475: 	  error_check("a = 3.", {badmatch,3}),
  476:     %% error_check("3.1 = 2.7.",{badmatch,2.7}),
  477: 	  error_check("$c = 4.", {badmatch,4}),
  478: 	  check(fun() -> $c = $c end, "$c = $c.", $c),
  479: 	  check(fun() -> _ = bar end, "_ = bar.", bar),
  480: 	  check(fun() -> A = 14, A = 14 end,
  481:                 "begin A = 14, A = 14 end.", 14),
  482: 	  error_check("begin A = 14, A = 16 end.", {badmatch,16}),
  483: 	  error_check("\"hej\" = \"san\".", {badmatch,"san"}),
  484: 	  check(fun() -> "hej" = "hej" end,
  485:                 "\"hej\" = \"hej\".", "hej"),
  486: 	  error_check("[] = [a].", {badmatch,[a]}),
  487: 	  check(fun() -> [] = [] end, "[] = [].", []),
  488: 	  error_check("[a] = [].", {badmatch,[]}),
  489: 	  error_check("{a,b} = 34.", {badmatch,34}),
  490: 	  check(fun() -> <<X:7>> = <<8:7>>, X end,
  491: 		"begin <<X:7>> = <<8:7>>, X end.", 8),
  492: 	  error_check("<<34:32>> = \"hej\".", {badmatch,"hej"}),
  493: 	  check(fun() -> trunc((1 * 3 div 3 + 4 - 3) / 1) rem 2 end,
  494:                 "begin trunc((1 * 3 div 3 + 4 - 3) / 1) rem 2 end.", 0),
  495: 	  check(fun() -> (2#101 band 2#10101) bor (2#110 bxor 2#010) end,
  496:                 "(2#101 band 2#10101) bor (2#110 bxor 2#010).", 5),
  497: 	  check(fun() -> (2#1 bsl 4) + (2#10000 bsr 3) end,
  498:                 "(2#1 bsl 4) + (2#10000 bsr 3).", 18),
  499: 	  check(fun() -> ((1<3) and ((1 =:= 2) or (1 =/= 2))) xor (1=<2) end,
  500:                 "((1<3) and ((1 =:= 2) or (1 =/= 2))) xor (1=<2).", false),
  501: 	  check(fun() -> (a /= b) or (2 > 4) or (3 >= 3) end,
  502:                 "(a /= b) or (2 > 4) or (3 >= 3).", true),
  503: 	  check(fun() -> "hej" ++ "san" =/= "hejsan" -- "san" end,
  504:                 "\"hej\" ++ \"san\" =/= \"hejsan\" -- \"san\".", true),
  505: 	  check(fun() -> (bnot 1) < -0 end, "(bnot (+1)) < -0.", true),
  506: 	  ok.
  507: 
  508: %% OTP-4929. Unary plus rejects non-numbers.
  509: unary_plus(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  510:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> + X end,
  511: 		   true = -1 == F(-1) end,
  512: 	  "begin F = fun(X) -> + X end,"
  513: 	  "      true = -1 == F(-1) end.", true, ['F'], none, none),
  514:     error_check("+a.", badarith),
  515:     ok.

  835: %% OTP-7550. Support for UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32.
  836: otp_7550(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  837: 
  838:     %% UTF-8.
  839:     check(
  840: 	    fun() -> <<65>> = <<65/utf8>> end,
  841: 	    "<<65>> = <<65/utf8>>.",
  842: 	    <<65>>),
  843:     check(
  844: 	    fun() -> <<350/utf8>> = <<197,158>> end,
  845: 	    "<<350/utf8>> = <<197,158>>.",
  846: 	    <<197,158>>),
  847:     check(
  848: 	    fun() -> <<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>> = <<"bj\366rn"/utf8>> end,
  849: 	    "<<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>> = <<\"bj\366rn\"/utf8>>.",
  850: 	    <<$b,$j,$\303,$\266,$r,$n>>),
  851: 
  852:     %% UTF-16.
  853:     check(
  854: 	    fun() -> <<0,65>> = <<65/utf16>> end,
  855: 	    "<<0,65>> = <<65/utf16>>.",
  856: 	    <<0,65>>),
  857:     check(
  858: 	    fun() -> <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf16>> end,
  859: 	    "<<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf16>>.",
  860: 	    <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>),
  861:     check(
  862: 	    fun() -> <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> = <<16#12345/little-utf16>> end,
  863: 	    "<<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> = <<16#12345/little-utf16>>.",
  864: 	    <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>),
  865: 
  866:     check(
  867: 	    fun() -> <<350/utf16>> = <<1,94>> end,
  868: 	    "<<350/utf16>> = <<1,94>>.",
  869: 	    <<1,94>>),
  870:     check(
  871: 	    fun() -> <<350/little-utf16>> = <<94,1>> end,
  872: 	    "<<350/little-utf16>> = <<94,1>>.",
  873: 	    <<94,1>>),
  874:     check(
  875: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/utf16>> = <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>> end,
  876: 	    "<<16#12345/utf16>> = <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>.",
  877: 	    <<16#D8,16#08,16#DF,16#45>>),
  878:     check(
  879: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf16>> = <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>> end,
  880: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf16>> = <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>.",
  881: 	    <<16#08,16#D8,16#45,16#DF>>),
  882: 
  883:     %% UTF-32.
  884:     check(
  885: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/utf32>> = <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> end,
  886: 	    "<<16#12345/utf32>> = <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>.",
  887: 	    <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>),
  888:     check(
  889: 	    fun() -> <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf32>> end,
  890: 	    "<<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>> = <<16#12345/utf32>>.",
  891: 	    <<16#0,16#01,16#23,16#45>>),
  892:     check(
  893: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf32>> = <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>> end,
  894: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf32>> = <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>.",
  895: 	    <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>),
  896:     check(
  897: 	    fun() -> <<16#12345/little-utf32>> end,
  898: 	    "<<16#12345/little-utf32>>.",
  899: 	    <<16#45,16#23,16#01,16#00>>),
  900: 
  901:     %% Mixed.
  902:     check(
  903: 	    fun() -> <<16#41,16#12345/utf32,16#0391:16,16#2E:8>> end,
  904: 	    "<<16#41,16#12345/utf32,16#0391:16,16#2E:8>>.",
  905: 	    <<16#41,16#00,16#01,16#23,16#45,16#03,16#91,16#2E>>),
  906:     ok.
  907: 
  908: 
  909: %% OTP-8133. Bit comprehension bug.
  910: otp_8133(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  911:     check(
  912:             fun() ->
  913:                   E = fun(N) ->
  914:                               if
  915:                                   is_integer(N) -> <<N/integer>>;
  916:                                   true -> throw(foo)
  917:                               end
  918:                       end,
  919:                   try << << (E(V))/binary >> || V <- [1,2,3,a] >>
  920:                   catch foo -> ok
  921:                   end
  922:             end,
  923:             "begin
  924:                  E = fun(N) ->
  925:                             if is_integer(N) -> <<N/integer>>;
  926:                                true -> throw(foo)
  927:                             end
  928:                      end,
  929:                  try << << (E(V))/binary >> || V <- [1,2,3,a] >>
  930:                  catch foo -> ok
  931:                  end
  932:              end.",
  933:             ok),
  934:     check(
  935:             fun() ->
  936:                   E = fun(N) ->
  937:                               if
  938:                                   is_integer(N) -> <<N/integer>>;
  939: 
  940:                                   true -> erlang:error(foo)
  941:                               end
  942:                       end,
  943:                   try << << (E(V))/binary >> || V <- [1,2,3,a] >>
  944:                   catch error:foo -> ok
  945:                   end
  946:             end,
  947:             "begin
  948:                  E = fun(N) ->
  949:                             if is_integer(N) -> <<N/integer>>;
  950:                                true -> erlang:error(foo)
  951:                             end
  952:                      end,
  953:                  try << << (E(V))/binary >> || V <- [1,2,3,a] >>
  954:                  catch error:foo -> ok
  955:                  end
  956:              end.",
  957:             ok),
  958:     ok.
  959: 
  960: %% OTP-10622. Bugs.
  961: otp_10622(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  962:     check(fun() -> <<0>> = <<"\x{400}">> end,
  963:           "<<0>> = <<\"\\x{400}\">>. ",
  964:           <<0>>),
  965:     check(fun() -> <<"\x{aa}ff"/utf8>> = <<"\x{aa}ff"/utf8>> end,
  966:           "<<\"\\x{aa}ff\"/utf8>> = <<\"\\x{aa}ff\"/utf8>>. ",
  967:           <<"Â\xaaff">>),
  968:     %% The same bug as last example:
  969:     check(fun() -> case <<"foo"/utf8>> of
  970:                        <<"foo"/utf8>> -> true
  971:                    end
  972:           end,
  973:           "case <<\"foo\"/utf8>> of <<\"foo\"/utf8>> -> true end.",
  974:           true),
  975:     check(fun() -> <<"\x{400}"/utf8>> = <<"\x{400}"/utf8>> end,
  976:           "<<\"\\x{400}\"/utf8>> = <<\"\\x{400}\"/utf8>>. ",
  977:           <<208,128>>),
  978:     error_check("<<\"\\x{aaa}\">> = <<\"\\x{aaa}\">>.",
  979:                 {badmatch,<<"\xaa">>}),
  980: 
  981:     check(fun() -> [a || <<"\x{aaa}">> <= <<2703:16>>] end,
  982:           "[a || <<\"\\x{aaa}\">> <= <<2703:16>>]. ",
  983:           []),
  984:     check(fun() -> [a || <<"\x{aa}"/utf8>> <= <<"\x{aa}"/utf8>>] end,
  985:           "[a || <<\"\\x{aa}\"/utf8>> <= <<\"\\x{aa}\"/utf8>>]. ",
  986:           [a]),
  987:     check(fun() -> [a || <<"\x{aa}x"/utf8>> <= <<"\x{aa}y"/utf8>>] end,
  988:           "[a || <<\"\\x{aa}x\"/utf8>> <= <<\"\\x{aa}y\"/utf8>>]. ",
  989:           []),
  990:     check(fun() -> [a || <<"\x{aaa}">> <= <<"\x{aaa}">>] end,
  991:           "[a || <<\"\\x{aaa}\">> <= <<\"\\x{aaa}\">>]. ",
  992:           []),
  993:     check(fun() -> [a || <<"\x{aaa}"/utf8>> <= <<"\x{aaa}"/utf8>>] end,
  994:           "[a || <<\"\\x{aaa}\"/utf8>> <= <<\"\\x{aaa}\"/utf8>>]. ",
  995:           [a]),
  996: 
  997:     ok.

 1074:     end,

 1094:                      ?MODULE]),

 1100:                     [{erl_eval,eval_b_generate,9}, {erl_eval, eval_bc, 7}]),
 1101:     backtrace_check("[A || A <- [1], begin a end].",
 1102:                     {bad_filter, a},
 1103:                     [{erl_eval,eval_filter,7}, {erl_eval, eval_generate, 9}]),
 1104:     fun() ->
 1105:             {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_Fun, []}}, BT}} =

 1113:     end(),

 1118:     backtrace_check("a orelse false.",

 1120:                     [{erl_eval,expr,6}, ?MODULE]),

 1131:                     simple,

 1138:                     [{erl_eval,expr,6}, ?MODULE]),

 1146:                     [{erl_eval,expr,6}, ?MODULE],
 1147:                     none, none),
 1148:     %% eval_bits

 1156:                      eval_bits,eval_bits],
 1157:                     none, none),

 1159:                     badarg,
 1160:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6},
 1161:                      eval_bits,eval_bits,erl_eval],
 1162:                     none, none),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% eval_bits with error info
 1165:     {error_info, #{cause := _, override_segment_position := 1}} =
 1166:         error_info_catch("<<100:8/bitstring>>.", badarg),
 1167: 
 1168:     {error_info, #{cause := _, override_segment_position := 2}} =

 1170: 
 1171:     ok.
 1172: 
 1173: simple() ->
 1174:     A = simple1(),
 1175:     {A}.
 1176: 
 1177: simple1() ->
 1178:     %% If the compiler could see that this function would always
 1179:     %% throw an error exception, it would rewrite simple() like this:
 1180:     %%
 1181:     %%   simple() -> simple1().
 1182:     %%
 1183:     %% That would change the stacktrace. To prevent the compiler from
 1184:     %% doing that optimization, we must obfuscate the code.
 1185:     case get(a_key_that_is_not_defined) of
 1186:         undefined -> erlang:error(simple);
 1187:         WillNeverHappen -> WillNeverHappen
 1188:     end.
 1189: 
 1190: custom_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1191:     EFH = {value, fun custom_stacktrace_eval_handler/3},
 1192: 
 1193:     backtrace_check("1 + atom.", badarith,
 1194:                     [{erlang,'+',[1,atom]}, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1195:     backtrace_check("\n1 + atom.", badarith,
 1196:                     [{erlang,'+',[1,atom]}, mystack(2)], none, EFH),
 1197: 
 1198:     backtrace_check("lists:flatten(atom).", function_clause,
 1199:                     [{lists,flatten,[atom]}, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1200: 
 1201:     backtrace_check("invalid andalso true.", {badarg, invalid},
 1202:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1203:     backtrace_check("invalid orelse true.", {badarg, invalid},
 1204:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1205: 
 1206:     backtrace_check("invalid = valid.", {badmatch, valid},
 1207:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1208: 
 1209:     backtrace_check("1:2.", {badexpr, ':'},
 1210:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1211: 
 1212:     backtrace_check("Unknown.", {unbound, 'Unknown'},
 1213:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1214: 
 1215:     backtrace_check("#unknown{}.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1216:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1217:     backtrace_check("#unknown{foo=bar}.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1218:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1219:     backtrace_check("#unknown.index.", {undef_record,unknown},
 1220:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1221: 
 1222:     backtrace_check("foo(1, 2).", undef,
 1223:                     [{erl_eval, foo, 2}, erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1224: 
 1225:     fun() ->
 1226:             {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_Fun, []}}, BT}} =
 1227:                 (catch parse_and_run("fun(A) -> A end().", none, EFH)),
 1228:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1229:     end(),
 1230: 
 1231:     fun() ->
 1232:             {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_Fun, []}}, BT}} =
 1233:                 (catch parse_and_run("fun F(A) -> A end().", none, EFH)),
 1234:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1235:     end(),
 1236: 
 1237:     backtrace_check("[X || X <- 1].", {bad_generator, 1},
 1238:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1239:     backtrace_check("[X || <<X>> <= 1].", {bad_generator, 1},
 1240:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1241:     backtrace_check("<<X || X <- 1>>.", {bad_generator, 1},
 1242:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1243:     backtrace_check("<<X || <<X>> <= 1>>.", {bad_generator, 1},
 1244:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1245: 
 1246:     backtrace_check("if false -> true end.", if_clause,
 1247:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1248:     backtrace_check("case 0 of 1 -> true end.", {case_clause, 0},
 1249:                     [erl_eval, mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1250:     backtrace_check("try 0 of 1 -> true after ok end.", {try_clause, 0},
 1251:                     [mystack(1)], none, EFH),
 1252: 
 1253:     backtrace_check("fun(0) -> 1 end(1).", function_clause,
 1254:                     [{erl_eval,'-inside-an-interpreted-fun-', [1]}, erl_eval, mystack(1)],
 1255:                     none, EFH),
 1256:     backtrace_check("fun F(0) -> 1 end(1).", function_clause,
 1257:                     [{erl_eval,'-inside-an-interpreted-fun-', [1]}, erl_eval, mystack(1)],
 1258:                     none, EFH),
 1259: 
 1260:     fun() ->
 1261:             {'EXIT', {{illegal_pattern,_}, BT}} =
 1262:                 (catch parse_and_run("make_ref() = 1.", none, EFH)),
 1263:             check_backtrace([erl_eval, mystack(1)], BT)
 1264:     end(),
 1265: 
 1266:     %% eval_bits
 1267:     backtrace_check("<<100:8/bitstring>>.",
 1268:                     badarg,
 1269:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6}, mystack(1)],
 1270:                     none, EFH),
 1271:     backtrace_check("<<100:8/foo>>.",
 1272:                     {undefined_bittype,foo},
 1273:                     [{eval_bits,make_bit_type,4}, mystack(1)],
 1274:                     none, EFH),
 1275:     backtrace_check("B = <<\"foo\">>, <<B/binary-unit:7>>.",
 1276:                     badarg,
 1277:                     [{eval_bits,eval_exp_field,6}, mystack(1)],
 1278:                     none, EFH),
 1279: 
 1280:     ok.
 1281: 
 1282: mystack(Line) ->
 1283:     {my_module, my_function, 0, [{file, "evaluator"}, {line, Line}]}.
 1284: 
 1285: custom_stacktrace_eval_handler(Ann, FunOrModFun, Args) ->
 1286:     try
 1287:         case FunOrModFun of
 1288:             {Mod, Fun} -> apply(Mod, Fun, Args);
 1289:             Fun -> apply(Fun, Args)
 1290:         end
 1291:     catch
 1292:         Kind:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 1293:             %% Take everything up to the evaluation function
 1294:             Pruned =
 1295:                 lists:takewhile(fun
 1296:                   ({erl_eval_SUITE,backtrace_check,5,_}) -> false;
 1297:                   (_) -> true
 1298:                 end, Stacktrace),
 1299:             %% Now we prune any shared code path from erl_eval
 1300:             {current_stacktrace, Current} =
 1301:                 erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace),
 1302:             Reversed = drop_common(lists:reverse(Current), lists:reverse(Pruned)),
 1303:             Location = [{file, "evaluator"}, {line, erl_anno:line(Ann)}],
 1304:             %% Add our file+line information at the bottom
 1305:             Custom = lists:reverse([{my_module, my_function, 0, Location} | Reversed]),
 1306:             erlang:raise(Kind, Reason, Custom)
 1307:     end.
 1308: 
 1309: drop_common([H | T1], [H | T2]) -> drop_common(T1, T2);
 1310: drop_common([H | T1], T2) -> drop_common(T1, T2);
 1311: drop_common([], [{?MODULE, custom_stacktrace_eval_handler, _, _} | T2]) -> T2;
 1312: drop_common([], T2) -> T2.
 1313: 
 1314: %% Simple cases, just to cover some code.
 1315: funs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1316:     do_funs(none, none),
 1317:     do_funs(lfh(), none),
 1318:     do_funs(none, efh()),
 1319:     do_funs(lfh(), efh()),
 1320:     do_funs(none, ann_efh()),
 1321:     do_funs(lfh(), ann_efh()),
 1322: 
 1323:     error_check("nix:foo().", {access_not_allowed,nix}, lfh(), efh()),
 1324:     error_check("nix:foo().", {access_not_allowed,nix}, lfh(), ann_efh()),
 1325:     error_check("bar().", undef, none, none),
 1326: 
 1327:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1328:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1329:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1330:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1331: 		0, ['F1'], lfh(), none),
 1332: 
 1333:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1334:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1335:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1336:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1337: 		0, ['F1'], lfh_value(), none),
 1338: 
 1339:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1340:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1341:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1342:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1343: 		0, ['F1'], lfh_value_extra(), none),
 1344: 
 1345:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1346:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1347:                 "begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> count_down(F, N) end,"
 1348:                 "F1(F1,1000) end.",
 1349: 		0, ['F1'], {?MODULE,local_func_value}, none),
 1350:     %% This is not documented, and only for backward compatibility (good!).
 1351:     B0 = erl_eval:new_bindings(),
 1352:     check(fun() -> is_function(?MODULE:count_down_fun()) end,
 1353:                 "begin is_function(count_down_fun()) end.",
 1354:                 true, [], {?MODULE,local_func,[B0]},none),
 1355: 
 1356:     EF = fun({timer,sleep}, As) when length(As) == 1 -> exit({got_it,sleep});
 1357:             ({M,F}, As) -> apply(M, F, As)
 1358:          end,
 1359:     EFH = {value, EF},
 1360:     error_check("apply(timer, sleep, [1]).", got_it, none, EFH),
 1361:     error_check("begin F = fun(T) -> timer:sleep(T) end,F(1) end.",
 1362:                       got_it, none, EFH),
 1363: 
 1364:     AnnEF = fun(1, {timer,sleep}, As) when length(As) == 1 -> exit({got_it,sleep});
 1365:                (1, {M,F}, As) -> apply(M, F, As)
 1366:          end,
 1367:     AnnEFH = {value, AnnEF},
 1368:     error_check("apply(timer, sleep, [1]).", got_it, none, AnnEFH),
 1369:     error_check("begin F = fun(T) -> timer:sleep(T) end,F(1) end.",
 1370:                       got_it, none, AnnEFH),
 1371: 
 1372:     error_check("fun a:b/0().", undef),
 1373: 
 1374:     MaxArgs = 20,
 1375:     [true] =
 1376:         lists:usort([run_many_args(SAs) || SAs <- many_args(MaxArgs)]),
 1377:     {'EXIT',{{argument_limit,_},_}} =
 1378:         (catch run_many_args(many_args1(MaxArgs+1))),
 1379: 
 1380:     check(fun() -> M = lists, F = fun M:reverse/1,
 1381: 			 [1,2] = F([2,1]), ok end,
 1382: 		"begin M = lists, F = fun M:reverse/1,"
 1383: 		" [1,2] = F([2,1]), ok end.",
 1384: 		ok),
 1385: 
 1386:     %% Test that {M,F} is not accepted as a fun.
 1387:     error_check("{" ?MODULE_STRING ",module_info}().",
 1388: 		{badfun,{?MODULE,module_info}}),
 1389: 
 1390:     %% Test defining and calling a fun based on an auto-imported BIF.
 1391:     check(fun() ->
 1392:                   F = fun is_binary/1,
 1393:                   true = F(<<>>),
 1394:                   false = F(a)
 1395:           end,
 1396:           ~S"""
 1397:            F = fun is_binary/1,
 1398:            true = F(<<>>),
 1399:            false = F(a).
 1400:            """,
 1401:           false, ['F'], lfh(), none),
 1402: 
 1403:     %% Test defining and calling a local fun defined in the shell.
 1404:     check(fun() ->
 1405:                   D = fun my_div/2,
 1406:                   3 = D(15, 5)
 1407:           end,
 1408:           ~S"""
 1409:            D = fun my_div/2,
 1410:            3 = D(15, 5).
 1411:            """,
 1412:           3, ['D'], lfh(), efh()),
 1413: 
 1414:     ok.
 1415: 
 1416: my_div(A, B) ->
 1417:     A div B.
 1418: 
 1419: run_many_args({S, As}) ->
 1420:     apply(eval_string(S), As) =:= As.
 1421: 
 1422: many_args(N) ->
 1423:     [many_args1(I) || I <- lists:seq(1, N)].
 1424: 
 1425: many_args1(N) ->
 1426:     F = fun(L, P) ->
 1427:                 tl(lists:flatten([","++P++integer_to_list(E) || E <- L]))
 1428:         end,
 1429:     L = lists:seq(1, N),
 1430:     T = F(L, "V"),
 1431:     S = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("fun(~s) -> [~s] end.", [T, T])),
 1432:     {S, L}.
 1433: 
 1434: do_funs(LFH, EFH) ->
 1435:     %% LFH is not really used by these examples...
 1436: 
 1437:     %% These tests do not prove that tail recursive functions really
 1438:     %% work (that the process does not grow); one should also run them
 1439:     %% manually with 1000 replaced by 1000000.
 1440: 
 1441:     M = atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 1442:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> ?MODULE:count_down(F, N) end,
 1443:                          F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1444:                 concat(["begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> ", M,
 1445:                         ":count_down(F, N) end, F1(F1,1000) end."]),
 1446: 		0, ['F1'], LFH, EFH),
 1447:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(F,N) -> apply(?MODULE,count_down,[F,N])
 1448:                               end, F1(F1, 1000) end,
 1449:                 concat(["begin F1 = fun(F,N) -> apply(", M,
 1450:                         ",count_down,[F, N]) end, F1(F1,1000) end."]),
 1451: 		0, ['F1'], LFH, EFH),
 1452:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 -> apply(F,[F,N-1]);
 1453:                                 (_F,0) -> ok end,
 1454:                          F(F, 1000)
 1455:                 end,
 1456:                 "begin F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 -> apply(F,[F,N-1]);"
 1457:                              "(_F,0) -> ok end,"
 1458:                        "F(F, 1000) end.",
 1459:                 ok, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1460:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 ->
 1461:                                      apply(erlang,apply,[F,[F,N-1]]);
 1462:                                 (_F,0) -> ok end,
 1463:                          F(F, 1000)
 1464:                 end,
 1465:                 "begin F = fun(F,N) when N > 0 ->"
 1466:                                    "apply(erlang,apply,[F,[F,N-1]]);"
 1467:                              "(_F,0) -> ok end,"
 1468:                        "F(F, 1000) end.",
 1469:                 ok, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1470:     check(fun() -> F = count_down_fun(),
 1471:                          SF = fun(SF, F1, N) -> F(SF, F1, N) end,
 1472:                          SF(SF, F, 1000) end,
 1473:                 concat(["begin F = ", M, ":count_down_fun(),"
 1474:                         "SF = fun(SF, F1, N) -> F(SF, F1, N) end,"
 1475:                         "SF(SF, F, 1000) end."]),
 1476:                 ok, ['F','SF'], LFH, EFH),
 1477: 
 1478: 
 1479:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> A = 1+X, {X,A} end,
 1480:                          true = {2,3} == F(2) end,
 1481:                 "begin F = fun(X) -> A = 1+X, {X,A} end,
 1482:                        true = {2,3} == F(2) end.", true, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1483:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> erlang:'+'(X,2) end,
 1484: 		   true = 3 == F(1) end,
 1485: 	  "begin F = fun(X) -> erlang:'+'(X,2) end,"
 1486: 	  "      true = 3 == F(1) end.", true, ['F'],
 1487: 	  LFH, EFH),
 1488:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> byte_size(X) end,
 1489:                          ?MODULE:do_apply(F,<<"hej">>) end,
 1490:                 concat(["begin F = fun(X) -> size(X) end,",
 1491:                         M,":do_apply(F,<<\"hej\">>) end."]),
 1492:                 3, ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1493: 
 1494:     check(fun() -> F1 = fun(X, Z) -> {X,Z} end,
 1495:                          Z = 5,
 1496:                          F2 = fun(X, Y) -> F1(Z,{X,Y}) end,
 1497:                          F3 = fun(X, Y) -> {a,F1(Z,{X,Y})} end,
 1498:                          {5,{x,y}} = F2(x,y),
 1499:                          {a,{5,{y,x}}} = F3(y,x),
 1500:                          {5,{5,y}} = F2(Z,y),
 1501:                          true = {5,{x,5}} == F2(x,Z) end,
 1502:                 "begin F1 = fun(X, Z) -> {X,Z} end,
 1503:                        Z = 5,
 1504:                        F2 = fun(X, Y) -> F1(Z,{X,Y}) end,
 1505:                        F3 = fun(X, Y) -> {a,F1(Z,{X,Y})} end,
 1506:                        {5,{x,y}} = F2(x,y),
 1507:                        {a,{5,{y,x}}} = F3(y,x),
 1508:                        {5,{5,y}} = F2(Z,y),
 1509:                        true = {5,{x,5}} == F2(x,Z) end.",
 1510:                 true, ['F1','Z','F2','F3'], LFH, EFH),
 1511:     check(fun() -> F = fun(X) -> byte_size(X) end,
 1512:                          F2 = fun(Y) -> F(Y) end,
 1513:                          ?MODULE:do_apply(F2,<<"hej">>) end,
 1514:                 concat(["begin F = fun(X) -> size(X) end,",
 1515:                         "F2 = fun(Y) -> F(Y) end,",
 1516:                         M,":do_apply(F2,<<\"hej\">>) end."]),
 1517:                 3, ['F','F2'], LFH, EFH),
 1518:     check(fun() -> Z = 5, F = fun(X) -> {Z,X} end,
 1519:                          F2 = fun(Z) -> F(Z) end, F2(3) end,
 1520:                 "begin Z = 5, F = fun(X) -> {Z,X} end,
 1521:                        F2 = fun(Z) -> F(Z) end, F2(3) end.",
 1522:                 {5,3},['F','F2','Z'], LFH, EFH),
 1523:     check(fun() -> F = fun(Z) -> Z end,
 1524:                          F2 = fun(X) -> F(X), Z = {X,X}, Z end,
 1525:                          {1,1} = F2(1), Z = 7, Z end,
 1526:                 "begin F = fun(Z) -> Z end,
 1527:                        F2 = fun(X) -> F(X), Z = {X,X}, Z end,
 1528:                        {1,1} = F2(1), Z = 7, Z end.", 7, ['F','F2','Z'],
 1529:                 LFH, EFH),
 1530:     check(fun() -> F = fun(F, N) -> [?MODULE:count_down(F,N) || X <-[1]]
 1531:                              end, F(F,2) end,
 1532:                 concat(["begin F = fun(F, N) -> [", M,
 1533:                        ":count_down(F,N) || X <-[1]] end, F(F,2) end."]),
 1534:                 [[[0]]], ['F'], LFH, EFH),
 1535:     ok.
 1536: 
 1537: count_down(F, N) when N > 0 ->
 1538:     F(F, N-1);
 1539: count_down(_F, N) ->
 1540:     N.
 1541: 
 1542: count_down_fun() ->
 1543:     fun(SF,F,N) when N > 0 -> SF(SF,F,N-1);
 1544:        (_SF,_F,_N) -> ok
 1545:     end.
 1546: 
 1547: do_apply(F, V) ->
 1548:     F(V).
 1549: 
 1550: lfh() ->
 1551:     {eval, fun(F, As, Bs) -> local_func(F, As, Bs) end}.
 1552: 
 1553: local_func(F, As0, Bs0) when is_atom(F) ->
 1554:     {As,Bs} = erl_eval:expr_list(As0, Bs0, lfh()),
 1555:     case erlang:function_exported(?MODULE, F, length(As)) of
 1556: 	true ->
 1557: 	    {value,apply(?MODULE, F, As),Bs};
 1558: 	false ->
 1559: 	    {value,apply(shell_default, F, As),Bs}
 1560:     end.
 1561: 
 1562: lfh_value_extra() ->
 1563:     %% Not documented.
 1564:     {value, fun(F, As, a1, a2) -> local_func_value(F, As) end, [a1, a2]}.
 1565: 
 1566: lfh_value() ->
 1567:     {value, fun(F, As) -> local_func_value(F, As) end}.
 1568: 
 1569: local_func_value(F, As) when is_atom(F) ->
 1570:     case erlang:function_exported(?MODULE, F, length(As)) of
 1571: 	true ->
 1572: 	    apply(?MODULE, F, As);
 1573: 	false ->
 1574: 	    apply(shell_default, F, As)
 1575:     end.
 1576: 
 1577: efh() ->
 1578:     {value, fun(F, As) -> external_func(F, As) end}.
 1579: 
 1580: ann_efh() ->
 1581:     {value, fun(_Ann, F, As) -> external_func(F, As) end}.
 1582: 
 1583: external_func({M,_}, _As) when M == nix ->
 1584:     exit({{access_not_allowed,M},[mfa]});
 1585: external_func(F, As) when is_function(F) ->
 1586:     apply(F, As);
 1587: external_func({M,F}, As) ->
 1588:     apply(M, F, As).
 1589: 
 1590: 
 1591: 
 1592: %% Test try-of-catch-after-end statement.
 1593: try_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1594:     %% Match in of with catch
 1595:     check(fun() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2 catch _:_ -> 3 end end,
 1596: 		"try 1 of 1 -> 2 catch _:_ -> 3 end.", 2),
 1597:     check(fun() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end end,
 1598: 		"try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.", 2),
 1599:     check(fun() -> try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end end,
 1600: 		"try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.", 4),
 1601:     %% Just after
 1602:     check(fun () -> X = try 1 after put(try_catch, 2) end,
 1603: 			  {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1604: 		"begin X = try 1 after put(try_catch, 2) end, "
 1605: 		"{X,get(try_catch)} end.", {1,2}),
 1606:     %% Match in of with after
 1607:     check(fun() -> X = try 1 of 1 -> 2 after put(try_catch, 3) end,
 1608: 			 {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1609: 		"begin X = try 1 of 1 -> 2 after put(try_catch, 3) end, "
 1610: 		"{X,get(try_catch)} end.", {2,3}),
 1611:     check(fun() -> X = try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4
 1612: 			     after put(try_catch, 5) end,
 1613: 			 {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1614: 		"begin X = try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 "
 1615: 		"          after put(try_catch, 5) end, "
 1616: 		"      {X,get(try_catch)} end.", {2,5}),
 1617:     check(fun() -> X = try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4
 1618: 			     after put(try_catch, 5) end,
 1619: 			 {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1620: 		"begin X = try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 "
 1621: 		"          after put(try_catch, 5) end, "
 1622: 		"      {X,get(try_catch)} end.", {4,5}),
 1623:     %% Nomatch in of
 1624:     error_check("try 1 of 2 -> 3 catch _:_ -> 4 end.",
 1625: 		      {try_clause,1}),
 1626:     %% Nomatch in of with after
 1627:     check(fun () -> {'EXIT',{{try_clause,1},_}} =
 1628: 			      begin catch try 1 of 2 -> 3
 1629: 				          after put(try_catch, 4) end end,
 1630: 			  get(try_catch) end,
 1631: 		"begin {'EXIT',{{try_clause,1},_}} = "
 1632: 		"          begin catch try 1 of 2 -> 3 "
 1633: 		"                      after put(try_catch, 4) end end, "
 1634: 		"      get(try_catch) end. ", 4),
 1635:     %% Exception in try
 1636:     check(fun () -> try 1=2 catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3 end end,
 1637: 		"try 1=2 catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3 end.", 3),
 1638:     check(fun () -> try 1=2 of 3 -> 4
 1639: 			  catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 5 end end,
 1640: 		"try 1=2 of 3 -> 4 "
 1641: 		"catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 5 end.", 5),
 1642:     %% Exception in try with after
 1643:     check(fun () -> X = try 1=2
 1644: 			      catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3
 1645: 			      after put(try_catch, 4) end,
 1646: 			  {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1647: 		"begin X = try 1=2 "
 1648: 		"          catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3 "
 1649: 		"          after put(try_catch, 4) end, "
 1650: 		"      {X,get(try_catch)} end. ", {3,4}),
 1651:     check(fun () -> X = try 1=2 of 3 -> 4
 1652: 			      catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 5
 1653: 			      after put(try_catch, 6) end,
 1654: 			  {X,get(try_catch)} end,
 1655: 		"begin X = try 1=2 of 3 -> 4"
 1656: 		"          catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 5 "
 1657: 		"          after put(try_catch, 6) end, "
 1658: 		"      {X,get(try_catch)} end. ", {5,6}),
 1659:     %% Uncaught exception
 1660:     error_check("try 1=2 catch error:undefined -> 3 end. ",
 1661: 		      {badmatch,2}),
 1662:     error_check("try 1=2 of 3 -> 4 catch error:undefined -> 5 end. ",
 1663: 		      {badmatch,2}),
 1664:     %% Uncaught exception with after
 1665:     check(fun () -> {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} =
 1666: 			      begin catch try 1=2
 1667: 					  after put(try_catch, 3) end end,
 1668: 			  get(try_catch) end,
 1669: 		"begin {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} = "
 1670: 		"          begin catch try 1=2 "
 1671: 		"                      after put(try_catch, 3) end end, "
 1672: 		"      get(try_catch) end. ", 3),
 1673:     check(fun () -> {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} =
 1674: 			      begin catch try 1=2 of 3 -> 4
 1675: 					  after put(try_catch, 5) end end,
 1676: 			  get(try_catch) end,
 1677: 		"begin {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} = "
 1678: 		"          begin catch try 1=2 of 3 -> 4"
 1679: 		"                      after put(try_catch, 5) end end, "
 1680: 		"      get(try_catch) end. ", 5),
 1681:     check(fun () -> {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} =
 1682: 			      begin catch try 1=2 catch error:undefined -> 3
 1683: 					  after put(try_catch, 4) end end,
 1684: 			  get(try_catch) end,
 1685: 		"begin {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} = "
 1686: 		"          begin catch try 1=2 catch error:undefined -> 3 "
 1687: 		"                      after put(try_catch, 4) end end, "
 1688: 		"      get(try_catch) end. ", 4),
 1689:     check(fun () -> {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} =
 1690: 			      begin catch try 1=2 of 3 -> 4
 1691: 					  catch error:undefined -> 5
 1692: 					  after put(try_catch, 6) end end,
 1693: 			  get(try_catch) end,
 1694: 		"begin {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} = "
 1695: 		"          begin catch try 1=2 of 3 -> 4 "
 1696: 		"                      catch error:undefined -> 5 "
 1697: 		"                      after put(try_catch, 6) end end, "
 1698: 		"      get(try_catch) end. ", 6),
 1699:     ok.
 1700: 
 1701: 
 1702: %% OTP-7933.
 1703: eval_expr_5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1704:     {ok,Tokens ,_} =
 1705: 	erl_scan:string("if a+4 == 4 -> yes; true -> no end. "),
 1706:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 1707:     {value, no, []} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, [], none, none, none),
 1708:     no = erl_eval:expr(Expr, [], none, none, value),
 1709:     try
 1710: 	erl_eval:expr(Expr, [], none, none, 4711),
 1711: 	function_clause = should_never_reach_here
 1712:     catch
 1713: 	error:function_clause ->
 1714: 	    ok
 1715:     end.
 1716: 
 1717: zero_width(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1718:     check(fun() ->
 1719: 			{'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<not_a_number:0>>),
 1720: 			ok
 1721: 		end, "begin {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<not_a_number:0>>), "
 1722: 		"ok end.", ok),
 1723:     ok.
 1724: 
 1725: eep37(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1726:     check(fun () -> (fun _(X) -> X end)(42) end,
 1727:           "(fun _(X) -> X end)(42).",
 1728:           42),
 1729:     check(fun () -> (fun _Id(X) -> X end)(42) end,
 1730:           "(fun _Id(X) -> X end)(42).", 42),
 1731:     check(fun () -> is_function((fun Self() -> Self end)(), 0) end,
 1732:           "is_function((fun Self() -> Self end)(), 0).",
 1733:           true),
 1734:     check(fun () ->
 1735:                   F = fun Fact(N) when N > 0 ->
 1736:                               N * Fact(N - 1);
 1737:                           Fact(0) ->
 1738:                               1
 1739:                        end,
 1740:                   F(6)
 1741:           end,
 1742:           "(fun Fact(N) when N > 0 -> N * Fact(N - 1); Fact(0) -> 1 end)(6).",
 1743:           720),
 1744:     ok.
 1745: 
 1746: eep43(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1747:     check(fun () -> #{} end, " #{}.", #{}),
 1748:     check(fun () -> #{a => b} end, "#{a => b}.", #{a => b}),
 1749:     check(fun () ->
 1750:                   Map = #{a => b},
 1751:                   {Map#{a := b},Map#{a => c},Map#{d => e}}
 1752:           end,
 1753:           "begin "
 1754:           "    Map = #{a => B=b}, "
 1755:           "    {Map#{a := B},Map#{a => c},Map#{d => e}} "
 1756:           "end.",
 1757:           {#{a => b},#{a => c},#{a => b,d => e}}),
 1758:     check(fun () ->
 1759:                   lists:map(fun (X) -> X#{price := 0} end,
 1760:                             [#{hello => 0, price => nil}])
 1761:           end,
 1762:           "lists:map(fun (X) -> X#{price := 0} end,
 1763:                      [#{hello => 0, price => nil}]).",
 1764:           [#{hello => 0, price => 0}]),
 1765:     check(fun () ->
 1766: 		Map = #{ <<33:333>> => "wat" },
 1767: 		#{ <<33:333>> := "wat" } = Map
 1768: 	  end,
 1769: 	  "begin "
 1770: 	  "   Map = #{ <<33:333>> => \"wat\" }, "
 1771: 	  "   #{ <<33:333>> := \"wat\" } = Map  "
 1772: 	  "end.",
 1773: 	  #{ <<33:333>> => "wat" }),
 1774:     check(fun () ->
 1775: 		K1 = 1,
 1776: 		K2 = <<42:301>>,
 1777: 		K3 = {3,K2},
 1778: 		Map = #{ K1 => 1, K2 => 2, K3 => 3, {2,2} => 4},
 1779: 		#{ K1 := 1, K2 := 2, K3 := 3, {2,2} := 4} = Map
 1780: 	  end,
 1781: 	  "begin "
 1782: 	  "    K1 = 1, "
 1783: 	  "    K2 = <<42:301>>, "
 1784: 	  "    K3 = {3,K2}, "
 1785: 	  "    Map = #{ K1 => 1, K2 => 2, K3 => 3, {2,2} => 4}, "
 1786: 	  "    #{ K1 := 1, K2 := 2, K3 := 3, {2,2} := 4} = Map "
 1787: 	  "end.",
 1788: 	  #{ 1 => 1, <<42:301>> => 2, {3,<<42:301>>} => 3, {2,2} => 4}),
 1789:     check(fun () ->
 1790: 		X = key,
 1791: 		(fun(#{X := value}) -> true end)(#{X => value})
 1792: 	  end,
 1793: 	  "begin "
 1794: 	  "    X = key, "
 1795: 	  "    (fun(#{X := value}) -> true end)(#{X => value}) "
 1796: 	  "end.",
 1797: 	  true),
 1798: 
 1799:     error_check("[camembert]#{}.", {badmap,[camembert]}),
 1800:     error_check("[camembert]#{nonexisting:=v}.", {badmap,[camembert]}),
 1801:     error_check("#{} = 1.", {badmatch,1}),
 1802:     error_check("[]#{a=>error(bad)}.", bad),
 1803:     error_check("(#{})#{nonexisting:=value}.", {badkey,nonexisting}),
 1804:     ok.

 1813:                           c
 1814:                   end()
 1815:           end,

 1817:                    a;
 1818:               () when #{a => b} ->
 1819:                    b;
 1820:               () when #{a => b} =:= #{a => b} ->
 1821:                    c
 1822:            end().",
 1823:           c),

 1826:                               a;

 1828:                               b;
 1829:                          (M) when M#{a := b} ->
 1830:                               c;

 1832:                               d;

 1834:                               e

 1842:                               b;

 1844:                               c;

 1941: eep49(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1942:     check(fun() ->
 1943:                   maybe empty end
 1944:           end,
 1945:           "maybe empty end.",
 1946:           empty),
 1947:     check(fun() ->
 1948:                   maybe ok ?= ok end
 1949:           end,
 1950:           "maybe ok ?= ok end.",
 1951:           ok),
 1952:     check(fun() ->
 1953:                   maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, A end
 1954:           end,
 1955:           "maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, A end.",
 1956:           good),
 1957:     check(fun() ->
 1958:                   maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {ok,also_good}, {A,B} end
 1959:           end,
 1960:           "maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {ok,also_good}, {A,B} end.",
 1961:           {good,also_good}),
 1962:     check(fun() ->
 1963:                   maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {error,wrong}, {A,B} end
 1964:           end,
 1965:           "maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {error,wrong}, {A,B} end.",
 1966:           {error,wrong}),
 1967: 
 1968:     %% Test maybe ... else ... end.
 1969:     check(fun() ->
 1970:                   maybe empty else _ -> error end
 1971:           end,
 1972:           "maybe empty else _ -> error end.",
 1973:           empty),
 1974:     check(fun() ->
 1975:                   maybe ok ?= ok else _ -> error end
 1976:           end,
 1977:           "maybe ok ?= ok else _ -> error end.",
 1978:           ok),
 1979:     check(fun() ->
 1980:                   maybe ok ?= other else _ -> error end
 1981:           end,
 1982:           "maybe ok ?= other else _ -> error end.",
 1983:           error),
 1984:     check(fun() ->
 1985:                   maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {ok,also_good}, {A,B}
 1986:                   else {error,_} -> error end
 1987:           end,
 1988:           "maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {ok,also_good}, {A,B} "
 1989:           "else {error,_} -> error end.",
 1990:           {good,also_good}),
 1991:     check(fun() ->
 1992:                   maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {error,other}, {A,B}
 1993:                   else {error,_} -> error end
 1994:           end,
 1995:           "maybe {ok,A} ?= {ok,good}, {ok,B} ?= {error,other}, {A,B} "
 1996:           "else {error,_} -> error end.",
 1997:           error),
 1998:     error_check("maybe ok ?= simply_wrong else {error,_} -> error end.",
 1999:                 {else_clause,simply_wrong}),
 2000:     ok.

 2002: %% GH-6348/OTP-18297: Lift restrictions for matching of binaries and maps.
 2003: binary_and_map_aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2004:     check(fun() ->
 2005:                   <<A:16>> = <<B:8,C:8>> = <<16#cafe:16>>,
 2006:                   {A,B,C}
 2007:           end,
 2008:           "begin <<A:16>> = <<B:8,C:8>> = <<16#cafe:16>>, {A,B,C} end.",
 2009:           {16#cafe,16#ca,16#fe}),
 2010:     check(fun() ->
 2011:                   <<A:8/bits,B:24/bits>> =
 2012:                       <<C:16,D:16>> =
 2013:                       <<E:8,F:8,G:8,H:8>> =
 2014:                       <<16#abcdef57:32>>,
 2015:                   {A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H}
 2016:           end,
 2017:           "begin <<A:8/bits,B:24/bits>> =
 2018:                  <<C:16,D:16>> =
 2019:                  <<E:8,F:8,G:8,H:8>> =
 2020:                  <<16#abcdef57:32>>,
 2021:                  {A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H}
 2022:            end.",
 2023:           {<<16#ab>>,<<16#cdef57:24>>, 16#abcd,16#ef57, 16#ab,16#cd,16#ef,16#57}),
 2024:     check(fun() ->
 2025:                   #{K := V} = #{k := K} = #{k => my_key, my_key => 42},
 2026:                   V
 2027:           end,
 2028:           "begin #{K := V} = #{k := K} = #{k => my_key, my_key => 42}, V end.",
 2029:           42),
 2030:     ok.

 2032: %% EEP 58: Map comprehensions.
 2033: eep58(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2034:     check(fun() -> X = 32, #{X => X*X || X <- [1,2,3]} end,
 2035: 	  "begin X = 32, #{X => X*X || X <- [1,2,3]} end.",
 2036: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2037:     check(fun() ->
 2038:                   K = V = none,
 2039:                   #{K => V*V || K := V <- #{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3}}
 2040:           end,
 2041:           "begin K = V = none, #{K => V*V || K := V <- #{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3}} end.",
 2042: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2043:     check(fun() ->
 2044:                   #{K => V*V || K := V <- maps:iterator(#{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3})}
 2045:           end,
 2046:           "#{K => V*V || K := V <- maps:iterator(#{1 => 1, 2 => 2, 3 => 3})}.",
 2047: 	  #{1 => 1, 2 => 4, 3 => 9}),
 2048:     check(fun() -> << <<K:8,V:24>> || K := V <- #{42 => 7777} >> end,
 2049:           "<< <<K:8,V:24>> || K := V <- #{42 => 7777} >>.",
 2050: 	  <<42:8,7777:24>>),
 2051:     check(fun() -> [X || X := X <- #{a => 1, b => b}] end,
 2052:           "[X || X := X <- #{a => 1, b => b}].",
 2053: 	  [b]),
 2054: 
 2055:     error_check("[K+V || K := V <- a].", {bad_generator,a}),
 2056:     error_check("[K+V || K := V <- [-1|#{}]].", {bad_generator,[-1|#{}]}),
 2057: 
 2058:     ok.
 2059: 
 2060: strict_generators(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2061:     %% Basic scenario for each comprehension and generator type
 2062:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]] end,
 2063:           "[X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]].",
 2064:           [2,3,4]),
 2065:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>] end,
 2066:           "[X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>].",
 2067:           [2,3,4]),
 2068:     check(fun() -> [X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}] end,
 2069:           "[X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}].",
 2070:           [2,12]),
 2071:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3]>> end,
 2072:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3]>>.",
 2073:           <<2,3,4>>),
 2074:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>> >> end,
 2075:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>> >>.",
 2076:           <<2,3,4>>),
 2077:     check(fun() -> << <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4} >> end,
 2078:           "<< <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4} >>.",
 2079:           <<2,12>>),
 2080:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]} end,
 2081:           "#{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3]}.",
 2082:           #{1 => 2, 2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2083:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>} end,
 2084:           "#{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>}.",
 2085:           #{1 => 2, 2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2086:     check(fun() -> #{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}} end,
 2087:           "#{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}}.",
 2088:           #{2 => 4, 4 => 8}),
 2089: 
 2090:     %% A failing guard following a strict generator is ok
 2091:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1] end,
 2092:           "[X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1].",
 2093:           [3,4]),
 2094:     check(fun() -> [X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1] end,
 2095:           "[X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1].",
 2096:           [3,4]),
 2097:     check(fun() -> [X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1] end,
 2098:           "[X*Y || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1].",
 2099:           [12]),
 2100:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1>> end,
 2101:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1>>.",
 2102:           <<3,4>>),
 2103:     check(fun() -> << <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1 >> end,
 2104:           "<< <<(X+1)>> || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1 >>.",
 2105:           <<3,4>>),
 2106:     check(fun() -> << <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1 >> end,
 2107:           "<< <<(X*Y)>> || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1 >>.",
 2108:           <<12>>),
 2109:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1} end,
 2110:           "#{X => X+1 || X <:- [1,2,3], X > 1}.",
 2111:           #{2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2112:     check(fun() -> #{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1} end,
 2113:           "#{X => X+1 || <<X>> <:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1}.",
 2114:           #{2 => 3, 3 => 4}),
 2115:     check(fun() -> #{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1} end,
 2116:           "#{X+1 => Y*2 || X := Y <:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1}.",
 2117:           #{4 => 8}),
 2118: 
 2119:     %% Non-matching elements cause a badmatch error
 2120:     error_check("[X || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}]].",
 2121:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2122:     error_check("[X || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>>].",
 2123:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2124:     error_check("[X || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok}].",
 2125:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2126:     error_check("<< <<X>> || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}] >>.",
 2127:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2128:     error_check("<< <<X>> || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>> >>.",
 2129:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2130:     error_check("<< <<X>> || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok} >>.",
 2131:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2132:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || {ok, X} <:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}]}.",
 2133:                 {badmatch,2}),
 2134:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || <<0:1, X:7>> <:= <<1,128,2>>}.",
 2135:                 {badmatch,<<128,2>>}),
 2136:     error_check("#{X => X+1 || X := ok <:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok}}.",
 2137:                 {badmatch,{2,error}}),
 2138: 
 2139:     %% Binary generators don't allow unused bits at the end either
 2140:     error_check("[X || <<X:3>> <:= <<0>>].",
 2141:                 {badmatch,<<0:2>>}),
 2142:     error_check("[Y || <<X, Y:X>> <:= <<8,1,9,2>>].",
 2143:                 {badmatch,<<9,2>>}),
 2144:     ok.
 2145: 
 2146: %% Check the string in different contexts: as is; in fun; from compiled code.
 2147: check(F, String, Result) ->
 2148:     check1(F, String, Result),
 2149:     FunString = concat(["fun() -> ", no_final_dot(String), " end(). "]),
 2150:     check1(F, FunString, Result),
 2151:     CompileString = concat(["hd(lists:map(fun(_) -> ", no_final_dot(String),
 2152:                             " end, [foo])). "]),
 2153:     check1(F, CompileString, Result).
 2154: 
 2155: check1(F, String, Result) ->
 2156:     Result = F(),
 2157:     Expr = parse_expr(String),
 2158:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, []) of
 2159:         {value, Result, Bs} when is_list(Bs) ->
 2160:             ok;
 2161:         Other1 ->
 2162:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2163:     end,
 2164:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, #{}) of
 2165:         {value, Result, MapBs} when is_map(MapBs) ->
 2166:             ok;
 2167:         Other2 ->
 2168:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2169:     end.
 2170: 
 2171: check(F, String, Result, BoundVars, LFH, EFH) ->
 2172:     Result = F(),
 2173:     Exprs = parse_exprs(String),
 2174:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, [], LFH, EFH) of
 2175:         {value, Result, Bs} ->
 2176:             %% We just assume that Bs is an orddict...
 2177:             Keys = orddict:fetch_keys(Bs),
 2178:             case sort(BoundVars) == sort(Keys) of
 2179:                 true ->
 2180:                     ok;
 2181:                 false ->
 2182:                     ct:fail({check, BoundVars, Keys})
 2183:             end,
 2184:             ok;
 2185:         Other1 ->
 2186:             ct:fail({check, Other1, Result})
 2187:     end,
 2188:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, #{}, LFH, EFH) of
 2189:         {value, Result, MapBs} ->
 2190:             MapKeys = maps:keys(MapBs),
 2191:             case sort(BoundVars) == sort(MapKeys) of
 2192:                 true ->
 2193:                     ok;
 2194:                 false ->
 2195:                     ct:fail({check, BoundVars, MapKeys})
 2196:             end,
 2197:             ok;
 2198:         Other2 ->
 2199:             ct:fail({check, Other2, Result})
 2200:     end.
 2201: 
 2202: error_check(String, Result) ->
 2203:     Expr = parse_expr(String),
 2204:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, []) of
 2205:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2206:             ok;
 2207:         Other1 ->
 2208:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2209:     end,
 2210:     case catch erl_eval:expr(Expr, #{}) of
 2211:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2212:             ok;
 2213:         Other2 ->
 2214:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2215:     end.
 2216: 
 2217: error_check(String, Result, LFH, EFH) ->
 2218:     Exprs = parse_exprs(String),
 2219:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, [], LFH, EFH) of
 2220:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2221:             ok;
 2222:         Other1 ->
 2223:             ct:fail({eval, Other1, Result})
 2224:     end,
 2225:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, #{}, LFH, EFH) of
 2226:         {'EXIT', {Result,_}} ->
 2227:             ok;
 2228:         Other2 ->
 2229:             ct:fail({eval, Other2, Result})
 2230:     end.
 2231: 
 2232: backtrace_check(String, Result, Backtrace) ->
 2233:     case catch parse_and_run(String) of
 2234:         {'EXIT', {Result, BT}} ->
 2235:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2236:         Other ->
 2237:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2238:     end.
 2239: 
 2240: backtrace_check(String, Result, Backtrace, LFH, EFH) ->
 2241:     case catch parse_and_run(String, LFH, EFH) of
 2242:         {'EXIT', {Result, BT}} ->
 2243:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2244:         Other ->
 2245:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2246:     end.
 2247: 
 2248: remove_error_info([{M, F, As, Info} | T]) ->
 2249:     [{M, F, As, lists:keydelete(error_info, 1, Info)} | T].
 2250: 
 2251: backtrace_catch(String, Result, Backtrace) ->
 2252:     case parse_and_run(String) of
 2253:         {value, {'EXIT', {Result, BT}}, _Bindings} ->
 2254:             check_backtrace(Backtrace, remove_error_info(BT));
 2255:         Other ->
 2256:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2257:     end.
 2258: 
 2259: error_info_catch(String, Result) ->
 2260:     case catch parse_and_run(String) of
 2261:         {'EXIT', {Result, [{_, _, _, Info}|_]}} ->
 2262:             lists:keyfind(error_info, 1, Info);
 2263:         Other ->
 2264:             ct:fail({eval, Other, Result})
 2265:     end.
 2266: 
 2267: check_backtrace([B1|Backtrace], [B2|BT]) ->
 2268:     case {B1, B2} of
 2269:         {M, {M,_,_,_}} ->
 2270:             ok;
 2271:         {{M,F,A}, {M,F,A,_}} ->
 2272:             ok;
 2273:         {B, B} ->
 2274:             ok
 2275:     end,
 2276:     check_backtrace(Backtrace, BT);
 2277: check_backtrace([], _) ->
 2278:     ok.
 2279: 
 2280: eval_string(String) ->
 2281:     {value, Result, _} = parse_and_run(String),
 2282:     Result.
 2283: 
 2284: parse_expr(String) ->
 2285:     Tokens = erl_scan_string(String),
 2286:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 2287:     Expr.
 2288: 
 2289: parse_exprs(String) ->
 2290:     Tokens = erl_scan_string(String),
 2291:     {ok, Exprs} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 2292:     Exprs.
 2293: 
 2294: erl_scan_string(String) ->
 2295:     %% FIXME: When the experimental features EEP has been implemented, we should
 2296:     %% dig out all keywords defined in all features.
 2297:     ResWordFun =
 2298:         fun('maybe') -> true;
 2299:            ('else') -> true;
 2300:            (Other) -> erl_scan:reserved_word(Other)
 2301:         end,
 2302:     {ok,Tokens,_} = erl_scan:string(String, 1, [{reserved_word_fun,ResWordFun}]),
 2303:     Tokens.
 2304: 
 2305: parse_and_run(String) ->
 2306:     erl_eval:expr(parse_expr(String), []).
 2307: 
 2308: parse_and_run(String, LFH, EFH) ->
 2309:     erl_eval:exprs(parse_exprs(String), [], LFH, EFH).
 2310: 
 2311: no_final_dot(S) ->
 2312:     case lists:reverse(S) of
 2313:         " ." ++ R -> lists:reverse(R);
 2314:         "." ++ R -> lists:reverse(R);
 2315:         _ -> S
 2316:     end.
